instruction: For the given input, decide if it is an example of descriptive or inferential statistics and explain why
input: Calculating the median cost of gas
output: This is an example of descriptive statistics, as the calculation of the median is used to describe a certain set of data (the cost of gas). Descriptive statistics is primarily used to summarize or organize the data in an understandable way which can be used to draw conclusions and make predictions. Inferential statistics, on the other hand, is used to make predictions and draw conclusions from the data, not just relate it.
